content.definition: Pathology affecting the aortic arch including aneurysm, dissection, atherosclerotic occlusive disease, and traumatic injury. The arch gives rise to the great vessels (innominate, left carotid, left subclavian) making treatment challenging due to cerebrovascular risks. Requires specialized approaches including deep hypothermic circulatory arrest, elephant trunk, or hybrid techniques.

anatomy.zone_3: Left subclavian to descending thoracic aorta

pathologies: Arch involvement in dissection (DeBakey I or II)

treatment_options.total_arch_replacement: Open surgery with DHCA, hemiarch or total arch
treatment_options.hybrid_debranching: Surgical bypass to arch vessels + TEVAR

clinical_pearls: Zone classification predicts landing zone options for TEVAR
Elephant trunk allows staged repair of extensive disease
Mobile aortic arch atheromas = stroke risk with catheterization
SACP preferred over RCP for neuroprotection in most centers

learning_objectives: Compare open vs hybrid approaches to arch disease
